üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

The hashtag#militaryexperience showcases both the best and the worst aspects of the journey: the relentless pursuit of perfection.During service, perfection is not just an aspiration but a quiet necessity.- Perfectly on cadence. üëû- Achieving a perfect PT score. üí™- Ensuring perfect uniform presentation. ü™ñ- Perfection in weapons qualification. üî´But, as you transition out the same level of perfection becomes a daunting and nearly unattainable standard. - Your resume might not be flawless.- Your hashtag#experience may not perfectly align with a role.- Project pitches may lack perfection in delivery.- The hashtag#jobsearch journey might not be flawless.- A 4.0 GPA may not be within reach.And that's perfectly ok!In the pursuit, it is important to acknowledge and appreciate the significant PROGRESS you are making.Remember to show yourself kindness and manage your expectations as you navigate your hashtag#militarytransition.This process is a marathon, not a sprint.Have you struggled with the pursuit of perfection post-military service?hashtag#careeradvice hashtag#militarymentoring hashtag#servicemember

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. The hashtag#militaryexperience showcases both the best and the worst aspects of the journey: the relentless pursuit of perfection.During service, perfection is not just an aspiration but a quiet necessity.- Perfectly on cadence. üëû- Achieving a perfect PT score. üí™- Ensuring perfect uniform presentation. ü™ñ- Perfection in weapons qualification. üî´But, as you transition out the same level of perfection becomes a daunting and nearly unattainable standard. - Your resume might not be flawless.- Your hashtag#experience may not perfectly align with a role.- Project pitches may lack perfection in delivery.- The hashtag#jobsearch journey might not be flawless.- A 4.0 GPA may not be within reach.And that's perfectly ok!In the pursuit, it is important to acknowledge and appreciate the significant PROGRESS you are making.Remember to show yourself kindness and manage your expectations as you navigate your hashtag#militarytransition.This process is a marathon, not a sprint.Have you struggled with the pursuit of perfection post-military service?hashtag#careeradvice hashtag#militarymentoring hashtag#servicemember

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

Of course, it‚Äôs a bit disheartening‚Äîbut my morale remains strong, One thought I‚Äôd like to share:A CV doesn't always reflect the full potential of a candidate. üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

The hashtag#militaryexperience showcases both the best and the worst aspects of the journey: the relentless pursuit of perfection.During service, perfection is not just an aspiration but a quiet necessity.- Perfectly on cadence. üëû- Achieving a perfect PT score. üí™- Ensuring perfect uniform presentation. ü™ñ- Perfection in weapons qualification. üî´But, as you transition out the same level of perfection becomes a daunting and nearly unattainable standard. - Your resume might not be flawless.- Your hashtag#experience may not perfectly align with a role.- Project pitches may lack perfection in delivery.- The hashtag#jobsearch journey might not be flawless.- A 4.0 GPA may not be within reach.And that's perfectly ok!In the pursuit, it is important to acknowledge and appreciate the significant PROGRESS you are making.Remember to show yourself kindness and manage your expectations as you navigate your hashtag#militarytransition.This process is a marathon, not a sprint.Have you struggled with the pursuit of perfection post-military service?hashtag#careeradvice hashtag#militarymentoring hashtag#servicemember

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

I recently received a rejection for a role in Unilever I was really hopeful & genuinely excited about. While it‚Äôs never easy to hear ‚Äúno,‚Äù my spirit remains unshaken. "Gonna refine my skills and grow from my mistakes, and I remain committed to never giving up."Because I know that one decision doesn‚Äôt define my worth or my journey.  Of course, it‚Äôs a bit disheartening‚Äîbut my morale remains strong, One thought I‚Äôd like to share:A CV doesn't always reflect the full potential of a candidate. Sometimes, a short conversation can reveal qualities that aren't easy to capture on paper‚Äîlike passion, mindset, and adaptability.I understand hiring is a complex process, and I appreciate every opportunity to grow and learn. When Interviews Feel Like Formalities ‚Äì A Real Experience hashtag#walmartI usually don‚Äôt post things like this, but after recent experiences, I feel it‚Äôs worth sharing.I‚Äôve applied to 20+ Walmart locations recently, and a few interviews were scheduled. But in many cases, it felt like the decision was already made before the interview even began‚Äîjust a formality. Once, I even traveled nearly 4 hours to attend an interview, only to realize the store wasn‚Äôt even clear on what role I was there for. It felt more like a checkbox exercise than a genuine hashtag#hiring hashtag#opportunity.What hurt the most was a recent situation‚Äîan interview was scheduled, I made all the arrangements: swapped my shift, rented a car, relied on friends for help, and cleared my day. Only to wake up to a cold "no longer under consideration" message before the interview even happened. No explanation. No courtesy call. Just... done.I understand hiring can be complex. But as candidates, we invest time, energy, and hope into these opportunities. A little clarity and respect can go a long way.Sharing this for anyone else facing the same thing‚Äîyou‚Äôre not alone. Keep going. And to companies like hashtag#walmart : please consider the human side of the hiring process.hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CandidateExperience hashtag#HiringTransparency hashtag#RespectMatters hashtag#walmart hashtag#walmartcanada hashtag#walmarthiring hashtag#walmartcareers hashtag#jobs2025 #hashtag#RetailExperience hashtag#WalmartCareers hashtag#CandidateExperience hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#HiringProcessMatters hashtag#RespectForCandidates hashtag#FairHiringPractices hashtag#WalmartCareers hashtag#LifeAtWalmart hashtag#WalmartHiring hashtag#WalmartJobs hashtag#WalmartInterviewExperience hashtag#WalmartWorkers

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëLinkedIn is a powerful platform for job seekers and professionals‚Äîbut it‚Äôs also becoming a playground for scammers. If you‚Äôve come across posts like these, be alert:üö® ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hiring for multiple roles! Like & comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô ‚Äì I‚Äôll review your profile.‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúApply using this link‚Äù (which leads to a sketchy site or personal profile) üö® ‚ÄúDrop your email & number in the comments ‚Äì we‚Äôll contact you!‚Äù üö® ‚ÄúComment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô to get shortlisted!‚Äù‚ö†Ô∏è These are scams, not real opportunities. They exist to: ‚úîÔ∏è Harvest your data ‚úîÔ∏è Boost fake engagement ‚úîÔ∏è Mislead desperate job seekers‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website ‚ùå Vague roles like ‚Äú12th pass + Freshers can apply‚Äù ‚ùå Personal info requested in DMs or comments ‚ùå No proper application channel (like a company careers page)üîê Stay Safe:‚úîÔ∏è Apply only via official company websites or verified platforms ‚úîÔ∏è Never share personal information publicly ‚úîÔ∏è Report suspicious postsLet‚Äôs protect our network! üí¨ If you've seen one of these posts recently, comment below or share this to spread awareness. hashtag#LinkedInScam hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#StaySafe hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#RecruitmentTruths hashtag#JobSeekersAlert

üõë Beware of the Biggest Scam on LinkedIn! üõëüö® "We are hiring for multiple positions. Like this post and comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô‚ÄîI will review your profile."üö® "Apply using this link" (which leads nowhere or to a personal account).üö® "Share your email and phone number, and we will contact you."üö® "Comment ‚ÄòInterested‚Äô below, and we will shortlist you."These are scams designed to collect your data and boost engagement‚Äînot real job offers! No professional recruiter or talent acquisition specialist hires this way.‚úÖ How to Spot Fake Job Posts:‚ùå No official company email or website‚ùå Vague job descriptions (e.g., "Freshers + 12th Pass Can Apply")‚ùå Requests for personal information in comments or DMs‚ùå No direct application process via a legitimate career portalüîπ Stay Safe: Always verify company details, apply through official websites, and never share your personal information publicly.Help spread awareness! üöÄ Like, Comment, and Share to protect job seekers from falling for these scams.hashtaghashtag#JobScamhashtaghashtag#FakeJobOffershashtaghashtag#LinkedInScamshashtaghashtag#HiringScamshashtaghashtag#JobSeekershashtaghashtag#CareerTipshashtaghashtag#Recruitmenthashtaghashtag#StaySafehashtaghashtag#JobSearchhashtaghashtag#FraudPrevention

Effective talent reviews go beyond tools and tech.They need the right questions to guide decisions.Here are eight questions to consider.‚ùìStrategic Alignment ‚Ü≥ What are our organization‚Äôs key priorities for the next 18-36 months? ‚ùìHigh Potential Identification‚Ü≥ Who are our HiPos? How do they align with our priorities and future needs?‚ùìSuccession Gaps‚Ü≥ What critical roles lack a clear succession plan?‚ùìDevelopmental Focus‚Ü≥ What's the most critical development action for each HiPo and successor to accelerate their readiness?‚ùìKey Talent Retention?‚Ü≥ What is the retention risk of key talent? How can we mitigate these risks?‚ùìAction Plan Clarity‚Ü≥ What specific actions are we all agreeing to take as a result of this review?‚ùìAccountability‚Ü≥ Who is responsible (non-HR) for ensuring each action is taken?‚ùìFollow-up‚Ü≥ What is the timing and expectation for reporting back on the progress and outcomes of the actions identified? My infographic includes the purpose of each question.These questions are examples. There are many more.üí°What's one question you would add?Share it here so we can benefit from your insights.I'll also put my infographic in the commentbox below.‚ôªÔ∏è Repost to help others with talent reviewsüîî Follow Brian Heger for more

I recently received a rejection for a role in Unilever I was really hopeful & genuinely excited about. While it‚Äôs never easy to hear ‚Äúno,‚Äù my spirit remains unshaken. "Gonna refine my skills and grow from my mistakes, and I remain committed to never giving up."Because I know that one decision doesn‚Äôt define my worth or my journey.  Of course, it‚Äôs a bit disheartening‚Äîbut my morale remains strong, One thought I‚Äôd like to share:A CV doesn't always reflect the full potential of a candidate. Sometimes, a short conversation can reveal qualities that aren't easy to capture on paper‚Äîlike passion, mindset, and adaptability.I understand hiring is a complex process, and I appreciate every opportunity to grow and learn. Just a gentle reminder that interviews can sometimes uncover more than resumes.Wishing the best to everyone navigating similar moments‚Äîkeep going, your value goes beyond what‚Äôs written.hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Resilience hashtag#LearningFromRejection

When Interviews Feel Like Formalities ‚Äì A Real Experience hashtag#walmartI usually don‚Äôt post things like this, but after recent experiences, I feel it‚Äôs worth sharing.I‚Äôve applied to 20+ Walmart locations recently, and a few interviews were scheduled. But in many cases, it felt like the decision was already made before the interview even began‚Äîjust a formality. Once, I even traveled nearly 4 hours to attend an interview, only to realize the store wasn‚Äôt even clear on what role I was there for. It felt more like a checkbox exercise than a genuine hashtag#hiring hashtag#opportunity.What hurt the most was a recent situation‚Äîan interview was scheduled, I made all the arrangements: swapped my shift, rented a car, relied on friends for help, and cleared my day. Only to wake up to a cold "no longer under consideration" message before the interview even happened. No explanation. No courtesy call. Just... done.I understand hiring can be complex. But as candidates, we invest time, energy, and hope into these opportunities. A little clarity and respect can go a long way.Sharing this for anyone else facing the same thing‚Äîyou‚Äôre not alone. Keep going. And to companies like hashtag#walmart : please consider the human side of the hiring process.hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#CandidateExperience hashtag#HiringTransparency hashtag#RespectMatters hashtag#walmart hashtag#walmartcanada hashtag#walmarthiring hashtag#walmartcareers hashtag#jobs2025 #hashtag#RetailExperience hashtag#WalmartCareers hashtag#CandidateExperience hashtag#JobSearchStruggles hashtag#HiringProcessMatters hashtag#RespectForCandidates hashtag#FairHiringPractices hashtag#WalmartCareers hashtag#LifeAtWalmart hashtag#WalmartHiring hashtag#WalmartJobs hashtag#WalmartInterviewExperience hashtag#WalmartWorkers
